news_header: Sonos discusses its Q1 2025 earnings, highlighting challenges and organizational changes under interim CEO Tom Conrad, including a workforce reduction and a focus on improving product experience and operational efficiency.
news_text: During the Q1 2025 earnings call, Sonos reported a revenue of $551 million, down 10% year-over-year. Interim CEO Tom Conrad emphasized the need for significant improvements in the company's core experience and announced a workforce reduction of about 200 employees to streamline operations. The company aims to enhance efficiency by reorganizing its product and engineering teams into functional groups. CFO Saori Casey provided financial insights, noting challenges in demand and the impact of recent app rollouts. The company anticipates a revenue range of $240 million to $265 million for Q2 2025.
